snippet: After 18 days of protests, Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan ordered his riot police to storm Gezi Park. As people fled the tear gas and water cannons, the police pursued them in the streets.
abstract: At least 44 people are injured as Turkish police, under government orders, storm Gezi Park, aiming water canons and tear gas at protesters; crackdown comes after Prime Min Recep Tayyip Erdogan had attempted to halt broader movement against him by offering compromise that included letting courts decide what should happen to park.

byline.original: By TIM ARANGO, SEBNEM ARSU and CEYLAN YEGINSU

lead_paragraph: After 18 days of protests, Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan ordered his riot police to storm Gezi Park. As people fled the tear gas and water cannons, the police pursued them in the streets.

headline.main: Police Storm Park in Istanbul, Setting Off a Night of Chaos
headline.print_headline: Turkish Police Storm Park Occupied by Protesters
